columns.text: In this problem, we need to solve the different break-even points using the values in Exercise 27.

So far, here is what we have:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q}&=30,000\\
\text{Initial investment}&=\$4,300,000\\
\text{D}=\dfrac{\$4,300,000}{5}&=\$860,000\\
\text{FC}&=\$1,025,000\\
\text{OCF}&=\$2,211,300\\
\text{Annuity factor}&=3.517
\end{aligned}$$


Where,
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q} &= \text{Quantity}\\
\text{D}&= \text{Depreciation}\\
\text{FC}&=\text{Fixed Cost}\\
\text{OCF}&=\text{Operating cash flow}
\end{aligned}$$

Moreover, we need to use the formula in Exercise 25 to solve these points:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q}&=\dfrac{\frac{\text{OCF}-\text{T}\times \text{D}}{1-\text{T}}+\text{FC}}{\text{P}-\text{v}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where,

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q} &= \text{Quantity}\\
\text{D}&= \text{Depreciation}\\
\text{FC}&=\text{Fixed Cost}\\
\text{OCF}&=\text{Operating cash flow}\\
\text{T}&=\text{Time}\\
\text{P}&=\text{Sale Price}\\
\text{v}&=\text{Variable cost}
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q}&=\dfrac{\frac{\$860,000-(0.22\times \$860,000)}{1-0.22}+\$1,025,000}{\$290-\$190}\\[15 pt]
&=18,850
\end{aligned}$$

The accounting break-even point is $18,850$ tons.

Substituting the known values, we get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q}&=\dfrac{\frac{-(0.22\times \$860,000)}{1-0.22}+\$1,025,000}{\$290-\$190}\\[15 pt]
&=7,824.36
\end{aligned}$$

The cash break-even point is at $7,824,36$ tons

The financial break-even point refers to the point wherein the NPV or net present value is exactly zero.

We can then use the formula in Step 1 to solve this. However, the value that we will use for the OCF will be the present value of cashflow which is the OCF multiplied by the annuity factor.

The financial break-even point is then:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q}&=\dfrac{\dfrac{(\$2,211,300\times 3.517)-0.22\times \$860,000}{1-0.22}+\$1,025,000}{\$290-\$190}\\[15 pt]
&=107,531.31
\end{aligned}$$

The company will reach financial break-even at $107,531.31$ tons.
